content: Aggressive therapy to prevent atrial fibrillation was recommended for patients in the rhythm-control group. Electrical cardioversion was recommended within 6 weeks after randomization in patients who did not have conversion to sinus rhythm after antiarrhythmic drug therapy. If necessary, a second cardioversion was recommended within 3 months after enrollment. Additional cardioversions were recommended for subsequent recurrences of atrial fibrillation. Amiodarone was the drug of choice for the maintenance of sinus rhythm, and either sotalol or dofetilide was used if required. 15 The installation of a permanent pacemaker was recommended if bradycardia prevented the use of antiarrhythmic drugs
